summary: An internal memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated July 8, 2019, detailing proactive instructions to place inmate Jeffrey Epstein on psychological observation or suicide watch upon his return from court. keyFacts: On July 8, 2019, the MCC proactively planned to place Jeffrey Epstein on a suicide watch or psychological observation status upon his return from court.
The memo explicitly cites Epstein's high-profile case, sex offense charges, pre-trial status, and potential for bad legal news as key risk factors for suicidality, per BOP statistics.
Instructions were given to R&D staff and Lieutenants to immediately notify the psychology department or on-call psychologist if Epstein returned after hours.
The document is a confidential internal memorandum, indicating institutional awareness of Epstein's vulnerability prior to his death.
